body_html:
This is a hack (so take it with a grain of salt), but I have had standard library issues with anaconda before.

The way I "solved" it was by symlinking libstdc++.so and libstdc++.so.6 in anaconda3 to the system versions while leaving libstdc++so.6.0.19 alone.

ls -al ~/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so*
lrwxrwxrwx 1 pavan pavan      14 Feb 21 19:55 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so -> libstdc++.so.6
lrwxrwxrwx 1 pavan pavan      23 Feb 21 19:56 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so.6 -> /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6
-rwxr-xr-x 2 pavan pavan 1055192 Sep 18  2015 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so.6.0.19
body_text:
This is a hack (so take it with a grain of salt), but I have had standard library issues with anaconda before.
The way I "solved" it was by symlinking libstdc++.so and libstdc++.so.6 in anaconda3 to the system versions while leaving libstdc++so.6.0.19 alone.
ls -al ~/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so*
lrwxrwxrwx 1 pavan pavan      14 Feb 21 19:55 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so -> libstdc++.so.6
lrwxrwxrwx 1 pavan pavan      23 Feb 21 19:56 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so.6 -> /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6
-rwxr-xr-x 2 pavan pavan 1055192 Sep 18  2015 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so.6.0.19
body:
This is a hack (so take it with a grain of salt), but I have had standard library issues with anaconda before. 

The way I "solved" it was by symlinking `libstdc++.so` and `libstdc++.so.6` in anaconda3 to the system versions while leaving `libstdc++so.6.0.19` alone.

```
ls -al ~/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so*
lrwxrwxrwx 1 pavan pavan      14 Feb 21 19:55 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so -> libstdc++.so.6
lrwxrwxrwx 1 pavan pavan      23 Feb 21 19:56 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so.6 -> /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6
-rwxr-xr-x 2 pavan pavan 1055192 Sep 18  2015 /home/pavan/Workspace/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so.6.0.19
```
